forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.shortForecast: Mostly Cloudy then Chance Light Rain
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain after 4am. Mostly cloudy. Low around 49, with temperatures rising to around 51 overnight. Southwest wind around 6 mph. Chance of precipitation is 30%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Wednesday
forecast.shortForecast: Chance Light Rain then Partly Sunny
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain before 10am. Partly sunny. High near 59, with temperatures falling to around 56 in the afternoon. Southwest wind 5 to 12 mph. Chance of precipitation is 30%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As the evening deepens in Downtown San Francisco, the city breathes in the gentle embrace of the night, cloaked in a layer of cloudiness that hints at the dampness to come. The temperature softly settles around a cool 49 degrees, offering a chill that brushes the skin like a whisper. With the forecast suggesting a chance of rain arriving after 4 AM, one can sense a quiet anticipation in the air, a reminder of the shifting moods of this unpredictable city. The low, rolling clouds perhaps hold their secrets close, but they promise a subtle ballet of precipitation that may grace the streets come morning.

As dawn approaches, the forecast transitions to a day where a blend of clouds and occasional sun will play across the skyline, breaking up the gray with fleeting moments of light. The high hovering near 59 invites layers—a light jacket or a cozy sweater—for those venturing out to enjoy the crispness of the day. While the anticipation of rain lingers, the winds will tease, blowing gently from the southwest at 5 to 12 mph. One might consider strolling through a quiet neighborhood, the sound of puddles softly splashing beneath their feet, or perhaps seeking solace in a quaint café, watching life unfold beyond the window. Although the haze may impede the clarity of the view, the allure of the city remains undiminished, embodying the soulful character that makes San Francisco eternally captivating.
